title: Poland and NATO Allies Shoot Down Russian Drones in Airspace Violation Incident
snippets: Poland said Wednesday that it and its NATO allies had shot down Russian drones that violated Polish airspace in what it called an "act of aggression" as Russia launched aerial attacks on Ukraine.
NATO member Poland scrambled air defenses in response to a "huge number of Russian drones" violating its airspace. The EU said the incursion appeared to be "intentional." DW has the latest.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMihAFBVV95cUxOUFd1dlpHZ1BCMWNTYU84TVNLOHFnM0I2NjcwN0JJQnExNmxONzJNZldXVnpjX0FmUHhRSHpFdGJWN3BRcTJQa29PMEVQbVpvemNIdWtoMU5Oa1dUY1QwU1JiUGZreXV3OFVIc3BrS3pGNk9UanZucWtVSnkwT0VSejdzMlY?oc=5" target="_blank">NATO member Poland's military says it shot down
Military officials in Poland say the country's airspace was "repeatedly violated by drone-type objects" in the overnight hours amid Russian strikes on targets in Ukraine.
Prime Minister Donald Tusk accuses Moscow of ‘large-scale provocation’ with incursions

Tusk says that those which posed a threat were shot down as Zelenskyy says incursion sets ‘extremely dangerous precedent for Europe’

  • Full

Donald Tusk says operation was launched after ‘repeated violations of Polish airspace’

  • Follow the latest updates live
The Russian action amounts to an unprecedented violation of Polish airspace and posed “a real threat” to Polish citizens, the Polish military said.
The Polish military called the incursions an “act of aggression.” It said the drones crossed the border during a wave of Russian strikes in Ukraine.
Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk said the drones posed a “direct threat” to his country and were therefore shot down.
Poland's prime minister said the country's armed forces downed Russian drones that could have posed a threat.
titles: Poland says it shot down Russian drones that violated its airspace
Poland hits drones in its airspace as Russia attacks Ukraine
NATO member Poland's military says it shot down Russian drones in its airspace - Axios
Poland downs Russian drones as 'huge number' violate airspace, prime minister says
Poland shoots down Russian drones
‘Huge number of Russian drones’ violated our airspace, says Poland’s PM – follow live
Poland shoots down drones over its territory amid Russian attack on Ukraine
Poland says it shot down Russian drones that violated its airspace
Poland Says It Shot Down Russian Drones That Entered Its Airspace
NATO Member Poland Says It Shot Down Russian Drones That Violated Its Airspace
Poland says it shot down Russian drones that repeatedly violated its airspace
summary: Poland and its NATO allies shot down Russian drones after they violated Polish airspace, an action Poland labeled as an "act of aggression." This incident occurred amid Russian aerial attacks on Ukraine, with the Polish military responding to a significant incursion of drones. The EU suggested the intrusion was intentional. Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk condemned the violation, highlighting the direct threat to Poland and describing it as a large-scale provocation. The situation marks an unprecedented violation of Polish airspace and has been deemed a serious security concern for Europe.

title: Judge Blocks Trump's Attempt to Fire Fed Governor Cook
snippets: Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook won a round in federal court in her bid to keep her job despite President Trump's effort to fire her.
The judge's ruling is a win for the US Federal Reserve following criticism by the president.
Federal judge blocks Trump's attempt to fire Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook.
The Supreme Court is likely to have the final say on whether President Donald Trump has legal cause to remove Lisa Cook from the Federal Reserve.
Ruling allows central bank board member to attend its next rate-setting meeting
The judge said Cook had made a strong argument that her “purported removal was done in violation of the Federal Reserve Act’s ‘for cause’ provision.”
President Donald Trump's historic decision to remove a member of the Federal Reserve board will likely head to the Supreme Court.
titles: Federal judge blocks Trump from firing Fed Governor Lisa Cook, for now
Trump temporarily blocked from firing Fed governor
Federal judge temporarily blocks Trump's attempt to fire Lisa Cook
Trump blocked from firing Fed Governor Lisa Cook as lawsuit plays out
Judge rules President Trump cannot fire Fed’s Lisa Cook for now
Federal Judge Temporarily Blocks Trump’s Firing Of Fed Governor Lisa Cook
Judge blocks Trump's attempt to fire Lisa Cook from Federal Reserve board, setting up Supreme Court showdown
summary: A federal judge has blocked President Trump's attempt to fire Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook, allowing her to retain her position and attend the next rate-setting meeting. The judge ruled that Trump's effort to remove Cook likely violated the Federal Reserve Act's 'for cause' provision. The case, marking a significant challenge to presidential authority over the Federal Reserve, is expected to be ultimately decided by the Supreme Court.

title: Trump Proposes Tariffs on India, China to Pressure Russia on Ukraine Talks
snippets: Steep tariffs would be part of joint effort to pressure Russia to end its war on Ukraine, according to reports.
U.S. President Donald Trump has asked the European Union to hit China and India with tariffs of up to 100% over the countries' Russia oil purchases.
US president makes extraordinary demand in bid to force Russia to end invasion of Ukraine

In effort to end Russia’s war in Ukraine, US president proposes tariffs of up to 100% targeting Putin allies and trade partners

Donald Trump has asked the EU to impose tariffs of up to 100% on India and China as part of an effort to force the Russian president, Vladimir Putin, to end the wa

In effort to end Russia’s war in Ukraine, US president reportedly proposes tariffs of up to 100% targeting Putin allies and trade partners

Donald Trump has asked the EU to impose tariffs of up to 100% on India and China as part of an effort to force the Russian president, Vladimir Putin, to
titles: Trump pushing EU to slap 100% tariffs on China, India, reports say
Trump presses European Union to impose 100% tariffs on India and China to pressure Putin
Trump tells EU to hit China and India with 100% tariffs to pressure Putin
Trump asks EU to impose high tariffs on India and China to put pressure on Russia
Trump reportedly asks EU to impose 100% tariffs on India and China
summary: President Donald Trump has proposed imposing new tariffs on India and China as a strategy to pressure Russia into negotiating with Ukraine. He stated this condition is contingent upon EU nations agreeing to implement similar measures. This move is part of an effort to end Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: Supreme Court to Fast-Track Case on Trump's Tariffs After Lower Court Rulings
snippets: The tariffs have become a flashpoint, with two lower courts declaring them illegal, and the president asking the Supreme Court for reversal as soon as possible.
Two lower courts have said some of President Trump's tariffs are unlawful. Now the Supreme Court has agreed to examine the issue.
The Supreme Court has scheduled to hear the case in November, lightning fast by its typical standards.
A federal appeals court recently ruled that many of President Donald Trump's wide-ranging tariffs in imports from most countries are illegal.
Case marks first test of president’s use of emergency powers to impose policies
titles: Supreme Court agrees to hear challenge to some of Trump's sweeping tariffs
Supreme Court will weigh in on Trump's tariffs. Here's what to know about the case
US Supreme Court to decide legality of Trump’s tariffs
Supreme Court will hear Trump tariffs case on fast track
US Supreme Court to consider legality of Trump’s tariffs in November
summary: The Supreme Court has agreed to expedite a case concerning the legality of some tariffs imposed by President Trump, following rulings by two lower courts that declared them illegal. This case represents a significant test of Trump's presidential authority and his economic policies. The Supreme Court is set to hear the case in November, indicating the urgency of the matter. If the Supreme Court upholds the lower court's decision, companies and consumers could seek refunds for the tariffs paid.

title: U.S. Informed Before Israel's Strike on Hamas in Qatar, Source Says
snippets: Hamas says six were killed but its leadership survived the attack, which the US says ‘does not advance Israel or America’s goals’
Qatar says it will continue its efforts to mediate between Israel and Hamas. But diplomats and analysts believe the short term prospects for peace look dim.
The attack in the Qatari capital, Doha, sought to assassinate much of Hamas’s leadership, but the militant group said no senior figures were killed.

DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — Israel struck the headquarters of Hamas’ political leadership in Qatar on Tuesday as the group’s top figures gathered to consider a U.S. proposal for a ceasefire in the Gaza Strip. The strike on the territory of a U.S. ally marked a stunning escalation
The Gulf nation of Qatar has been trying to negotiate a cease-fire in the conflict. The attack threatened to destabilize those peace efforts.
titles: Israel launches airstrikes against top Hamas members in Qatar for Gaza ceasefire talks
Israeli strike takes fight with Hamas to Qatar, key intermediary in Gaza talks
Israeli airstrike targets top Hamas leaders, upending ceasefire talks
Israeli strike in Qatar targets Hamas leaders as they weigh Gaza ceasefire proposal
Israel Attempts to Kill Hamas Leadership in Airstrike on Qatar, a Gaza War Mediator
summary: The U.S. was informed before Israel conducted a strike on Hamas in Qatar, described by Doha as a cowardly act and a violation of international law. This information comes from a source familiar with the situation but not authorized to speak publicly. The Pentagon has not commented on the matter.

title: Nepal Protests Turn Violent: 19 Dead, 200 Injured Amid Anti-Corruption Outcry
snippets: At least 19 people have been killed in the protests and more than 200 others were admitted to the hospital due to injuries, according to Nepal's Civil Service Hospital.
Fierce protests against corruption and nepotism spiralled into arson and violence on Tuesday.
Protests in Nepal turned  deadly after thousands of youngsters marched against the blocking of social media platforms.
Demonstrators have set fire to government buildings. The military has sent in troops to restore order.
A recent ban on social media brought young people to the streets, but they came filled with grievances that have built up over years.
titles: What to know about the mass Gen Z protests in Nepal
Nepal protests 'hijacked', Gen Z claim, as army patrols the streets
What we know about anti-corruption protests in Nepal
Explosive Protests in Nepal
The Forces Behind Nepal’s Explosive Gen Z Protests: What to Know
summary: In Nepal, protests against corruption, nepotism, and a social media ban escalated into violence, resulting in at least 19 deaths and over 200 injuries. Demonstrations turned deadly when protestors, primarily young people frustrated by longstanding grievances, resorted to arson, attacking government buildings. The military has been deployed to restore order amidst the chaos.

title: Novo Nordisk to Cut 9,000 Jobs, Focus on Obesity, Diabetes Meds
snippets: Novo Nordisk, which produces Wegovy and Ozempic, said roughly 9,000 roles would be cut, with 5,000 of these reductions expected in Denmark.

Danish manufacturer of weight-loss and diabetes drugs under pressure from US rival Eli Lilly

  • Business live – latest news

The maker

FRANKFURT, Germany (AP) — Danish pharmaceutical company Novo Nordisk, maker of weight-loss drug Wegovy, said Wednesday it would cut 9,000 jobs, 5,000 of them in Denmark, in order to strengthen the company’s focus on growth opportunities in obesity and diabetes medications. The restructur
titles: Wegovy-maker Novo Nordisk to cut around 9,000 jobs
Ozempic maker Novo Nordisk to cut 9,000 jobs amid increased competition
Novo Nordisk, maker of obesity drug Wegovy, to cut 9,000 jobs to sharpen focus, meet competition
summary: Novo Nordisk, a Danish pharmaceutical company, announced it will cut 9,000 jobs, with 5,000 of these in Denmark, to focus on growth in obesity and diabetes medications. This move comes as the company faces competition from US rival Eli Lilly.

title: Iran, IAEA Sign Deal in Cairo to Renew Nuclear Inspections
snippets: Iran and the International Atomic Energy Agency signed an agreement in Cairo to pave the way for resuming cooperation, including on ways of relaunching inspections of Iran's nuclear facilities.

Iran and the IAEA agreed on a new cooperation framework which could lead to the resumption of nuclear site inspections, largely stalled since Israel then the US attacked Iranian nuclear facilities in June.
Iran has not allowed inspections since its nuclear sites were bombed by Israel and the United States in June, but it hopes to stave off Western economic sanctions.
titles: Iran and nuclear watchdog sign agreement seeking path to restart cooperation
Iran, UN nuclear watchdog progress on nuclear inspections
Iran and U.N. Watchdog Reach Agreement to Resume Nuclear Inspections
summary: Iran and the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) signed an agreement in Cairo, setting a framework for renewed cooperation and the potential resumption of inspections at Iran's nuclear facilities. This move comes after inspections were largely halted following attacks on these sites by Israel and the United States in June. The agreement aims to facilitate inspections and avert Western economic sanctions against Iran.

title: Israel Airstrike Targets Hamas Leaders in Qatar, Sparks International Criticism
snippets: The Doha attack signals that Benjamin Netanyahu will press forward hard on all fronts, writes Jeremy Bowen.
Hamas says six people killed in air strike but its leadership team survived.
The Israeli military says it attacked Hamas' leadership in Qatar's capital, Doha, where the militant group's political leaders and negotiators are based.
Israeli leader Benjamin Netanyahu said the strike in Doha, Qatar, was to avenge Oct. 7. "The days are over when terror leaders can enjoy immunity," he said.
titles: Bowen: Diplomacy in ruins after Israel strikes Hamas leaders in Qatar
Israel Strikes Hamas In Qatar
Israeli military strikes Hamas leaders in Qatar
Israel expands campaign beyond Gaza, hitting Hamas leaders in Qatar
summary: Israel conducted an airstrike in Doha, Qatar, targeting senior Hamas leaders, sparking criticism from Qatar, which condemned the attack as 'criminal' and a threat to peace efforts. The U.S. Embassy in Doha responded with a shelter-in-place order. This action marks a significant escalation, as Hamas' exiled leadership, involved in long-standing negotiations with Israel facilitated by Qatar, was targeted.

title: Apple Launches iPhone with A19 Chip, Bigger Battery, and Advanced Camera
snippets: It’s less noticeable than a thinner profile or trick camera lenses, but Apple is pointing out another upgrade in the iPhone 17 family of phones that it says is part of “the most significant upgrade to memory safety in the history of consumer operating systems.” Explicitly targeting the spyware indus

The devices are powered by the new A19 Pro chipset and have a larger battery, Apple said. Plus, it noted that eSIM-only models will have a slightly larger battery as compared to Pro models with physical SIMs.
Aluminum unibody and three-lens "camera plateau" give the phone a new look.
titles: Apple says the iPhone 17 comes with a massive security upgrade
Apple launches iPhone 17 Pro with major camera upgrades
Apple “started from scratch” to design all-new iPhone 17 Pro and Pro Max
summary: Apple's latest iPhone features an A19 Pro chipset, a larger battery, and an aluminum unibody design with a three-lens camera plateau. The company highlighted that eSIM-only models will have a slightly larger battery than those with physical SIMs. This enhancement continues to make digital cameras unnecessary for casual users, further integrating all necessary photography capabilities into the iPhone.

title: Man Charged in Fatal Stabbing of Ukrainian Immigrant on NC Train
snippets: <a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMilgFBVV95cUxOOXJOLTAxd1NFRHZ6T25qRzdYc05fUU1hbjVJRkFUd1llZVdhYXVWSmF5d0RuQllFTEplZWxRRjlPZXJhallmZ29leExBeUJ6alg4QnRvNEZqdlZ6ZmJIcUpwMWpEREpva3l1dklaaG9pMDg5ekNZUVpPOVpvdnRyNXJManJ3YTl5bzBCVEtBSHZ3bkZBcnc?oc=5" target="_blank">Suspect in stabbing deat

Charge for Decarlos B Jr, accused of killing Iryna Zarutska in apparent random attack on train, could carry death penalty

The justice department on Tuesday charged a man accused of fatally stabbing a Ukrainian refugee on a North Carolina commuter train last month with a federal crime that c
titles: Suspect in stabbing death of Ukrainian refugee charged with federal crime - Axios
Suspect in Charlotte train stabbing facing federal charges, possible death penalty
Suspect in stabbing of Ukrainian woman in North Carolina charged with federal crime
summary: Decarlos B Jr. has been charged by the justice department with a federal crime for the fatal stabbing of Ukrainian immigrant Iryna Zarutska on a North Carolina commuter train last month. The attack, which appears to be random, could result in the death penalty for the accused.

title: Apple Unveils iPhone Air, iPhone 17, and New Watches with Health Alerts
snippets: The iPhone Air and the iPhone 17 fleet of phones took the spotlight during Apple’s “Awe dropping” event. If you weren’t tempted by the new phones, the fact that the entire Apple Watch lineup got refreshed might have been even bigger news to you. Soon, the Apple Watch SE 3, Apple Watch Series 11, and
One perk is the Apple Watch Series 11 can alert you to possible hypertension. Apple says it plans to notify over 1 million people with undiagnosed hypertension in the first year alone.
$799 Ultra Watch 3 will debut alongside the Watch Series 11 and Watch SE 3.
titles: How to preorder the Apple Watch SE 3, Apple Watch Series 11, and Apple Watch Ultra 3
Apple unveils Apple Watch Series 11, Watch Ultra 3, and Watch SE 3
Apple adds hypertension and sleep-quality monitoring to Watch Ultra 3, Series 11
summary: At Apple's "Awe dropping" event, the iPhone Air, iPhone 17, and a refreshed Apple Watch lineup were announced. The new Apple Watch Series 11 features a hypertension alert system, aiming to notify over 1 million people of undiagnosed hypertension in its first year. Additionally, the $799 Ultra Watch 3 was introduced alongside the Watch Series 11 and Watch SE 3.

title: Heineman's 10th-Inning Hit Secures Blue Jays Win Over Astros
snippets: Tyler Heineman was still buzzing around the Toronto Blue Jays clubhouse more than 40 minutes after he drove in the winning run in the 10th inning.

Joon Lee joins Evanka Osmak and Ken Reid to discuss the Blue Jays’ gritty win over the Astros, how the win gives perspective despite losing Bo Bichette from the lineup, who will need to step up in his absence, and how Vlad Guerrero Jr. set the tone.
titles: Blue Jays lose Bichette, but win thriller
How ‘gritty’ win gives Blue Jays perspective despite losing Bichette
summary: Tyler Heineman drove in the winning run for the Toronto Blue Jays in the 10th inning, securing a victory over the Astros. The win is significant as it comes during a period when the team is without key player Bo Bichette. Discussions on the game highlight the team's resilience and the need for players, including Vlad Guerrero Jr., to step up in Bichette's absence.

title: Premier League Resumes After International Break and Transfer Window

Which Scottish Premiership clubs are stronger after international break?
summary: The first international break of the season has ended, with Premier League players returning from representing their countries in World Cup qualifiers. The Scottish Premiership is set to resume this weekend, following the conclusion of the international break and the transfer window.

Afghanistan begin their Asia Cup campaign with a thrashing of tournament minnows Hong Kong in Abu Dhabi.

Afghanistan dominate Hong Kong in Asia Cup 2025 cricket opener
summary: Afghanistan started their Asia Cup campaign by defeating Hong Kong in Abu Dhabi. The match ended with Afghanistan dominating Hong Kong, showcasing a strong performance. Afghanistan's victory sets a positive tone for their participation in the tournament.

Andre Ward writes for BBC Sport, asking if Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez can find the blueprint to beat Terence Crawford on Saturday.

title: Trump Signs Executive Action for Transparency in Pharma Ads
snippets: The Trump administration plans to ensure transparency and accuracy in drug ads, including by increasing the amount of information related to any product risks.

President Donald Trump’s administration on Tuesday rolled out an executive action aimed at limiting direct-to-consumer advertising for pharmaceuticals, with officials saying a recent Hims & Hers Health Inc. ad stood out as an example of what should be prevented.
titles: Trump signs memo to crack down on direct-to-consumer pharma ads
Trump aims to curb direct-to-consumer ads for drugs. Hims & Hers Health could be targeted.
summary: President Trump signed an executive action on Tuesday targeting pharmaceutical companies to enforce transparency in their advertising, especially on social media. This move aims to increase the disclosure of product risks in direct-to-consumer ads, as part of the administration's effort to ensure accuracy and transparency. The action was partly motivated by concerns over specific ads, including one by Hims & Hers Health Inc., cited as an example of the type of advertising the administration seeks to regulate.

title: Kyle Schwarber Hits 50th HR, Joins Ryan Howard in Phillies History
snippets: Schwarber's seventh-inning blast came off the bat at 110.4 mph and went 437 feet to center

Watch as Philadelphia Phillies outfielder Kyle Schwarber launches his 50th home run of the season against the New York Mets to join Ryan Howard as the second player in franchise history to reach that milestone.
Phillies designated hitter Kyle Schwarber reached 50 homers in a season for the first time in his career when he hit a three-run shot Tuesday night against the New York Mets.
titles: Phillies' Kyle Schwarber hits 50th home run of season, becomes second in franchise history to accomplish feat
Schwarber cranks 50th home run to drive in three runs for Phillies
Phillies’ Kyle Schwarber hits 50th HR, Suarez strikes out 12 in win over Mets
summary: Philadelphia Phillies outfielder Kyle Schwarber hit his 50th home run of the season in a game against the New York Mets, becoming the second player in franchise history, alongside Ryan Howard, to reach this milestone. Schwarber's three-run homer, which marked the first time he has hit 50 homers in a season, came off the bat at 110.4 mph and traveled 437 feet to center field.

title: Supreme Court Fast-Tracks Case on Trump Tariffs
snippets: Trump tariff case gets fast tracked by Supreme Court
The Supreme Court has not indicated when it might rule on a request by the Trump administration to decide quickly on whether many new tariffs are legal.
titles: Trump tariff case gets fast tracked by Supreme Court - Axios
Potential Trump tariff refund bill could top $1 trillion as Supreme Court fight looms
summary: The Supreme Court is fast-tracking a case regarding the legality of new tariffs introduced by the Trump administration. However, there is no indication yet of when a ruling might be made.

title: Klarna IPO Priced at $40, Valuation Hits $15 Billion
snippets: Klarna priced its IPO at $40 a share, an offering that values the company at about $15 billion.
Klarna’s IPO priced at $40 late Tuesday, well above its expected range of $35 to $37.
titles: Klarna prices IPO at $40, above online lender's expected range
Klarna prices IPO well above expected range, raising $1.37 billion
summary: Klarna's IPO was priced at $40 per share, valuing the company at around $15 billion, exceeding the expected range of $35 to $37. This successful pricing indicates strong investor interest in the company.

title: Judge Pauses Anthropic's $1.5B Book Piracy Settlement, Cites Misleading Terms
snippets: Anthropic’s $1.5 billion book piracy settlement has been put on pause after the federal judge overseeing the class action case raised concerns about the terms of the agreement. During a hearing this week, Judge William Alsup rejected the settlement over concerns that class action lawyers will create
Feeling “misled,” judge refuses to rubber-stamp Anthropic's proposed settlement.
titles: Judge puts Anthropic’s $1.5 billion book piracy settlement on hold
Judge: Anthropic’s $1.5B settlement is being shoved “down the throat of authors”
summary: A federal judge has halted Anthropic's $1.5 billion book piracy settlement, expressing concerns over the terms and feeling misled. Judge William Alsup rejected the proposed agreement during a hearing, pausing the settlement process.

Apple debuts the $999 ultra-thin iPhone Air
Apple launches iPhone 17 with a 120 Hz display

titles: Asian Stocks Fluctuate as US Jobs Outlook Cools: Markets Wrap - Bloomberg.com
Wall Street Rally Stalls After US Jobs Markdown: Markets Wrap - Bloomberg.com
summary: Asian stocks showed mixed performance with fluctuations observed across the market, while a rally on Wall Street experienced a stall. The varied movements in the stock markets reflect ongoing adjustments and reactions to global financial conditions. The current status indicates a period of uncertainty and variability in stock market performances.
